title: Hong Kong Medical Community Rallies Against Police Brutality
text:
Hong Kong medical workers rallied in Chater Garden on October 26 to speak out against violence and the presence of riot police at hospitals during the city’s ongoing protests.

Banners bearing the words “doctors and patients join together, protect Hong Kong people” were laid out at the event, and participants chanted “resist” against the police, as this footage shows.

According to local media, speeches were made to show solidarity with doctors, nurses, and first responders who had been arrested during the protests. An estimated thousand people reportedly attended as riot police monitored the event. Credit: SocREC via Storyful
